info.title: Covid Act Now API
info.description: The Covid Act Now API provides historical covid projections updated daily.

parameters.name: cbsa_code
parameters.description:
5 Letter core-based statistical area (CBSA) Code.

For a list of all CBSA codes, refer to the
[Spreadsheet of CBSA Codes](https://github.com/covid-projections/covid-data-public/raw/main/data/census-msa/list1_2020.xls). This list includes a CBSA code to County mapping.

currentUsageTotal.title: Currentusagetotal
currentUsageTotal.description: Currently used capacity for resource by all patients (COVID + Non-COVID)

currentUsageCovid.title: Currentusagecovid
currentUsageCovid.description: Currently used capacity for resource by COVID

typicalUsageRate.title: Typicalusagerate
typicalUsageRate.description: Typical used capacity rate for resource. This excludes any COVID usage.

deaths.title: Deaths
deaths.description: Cumulative deaths that are suspected or confirmed to have been caused by COVID-19.

positiveTests.title: Positivetests
positiveTests.description: Cumulative positive test results to date

negativeTests.title: Negativetests
negativeTests.description: Cumulative negative test results to date

hospitalBeds.title: Hospitalbeds
hospitalBeds.description:
Information about acute bed utilization details.

Fields:
 * capacity - Current staffed acute bed capacity.
 * currentUsageTotal - Total number of acute beds currently in use
 * currentUsageCovid - Number of acute beds currently in use by COVID patients.
 * typicalUsageRate - Typical acute bed utilization rate.

icuBeds.title: Icubeds
icuBeds.description:
Information about ICU bed utilization details.

Fields:
 * capacity - Current staffed ICU bed capacity.
 * currentUsageTotal - Total number of ICU beds currently in use
 * currentUsageCovid - Number of ICU beds currently in use by COVID patients.
 * typicalUsageRate - Typical ICU utilization rate.

newCases.title: Newcases
newCases.description:
New confirmed or suspected cases.

New cases are a processed timeseries of cases - summing new cases may not equal
the cumulative case count.

Processing steps:
 1. If a region does not report cases for a period of time but then begins reporting again,
    we will exclude the first day that reporting recommences. This first day likely includes
    multiple days worth of cases and can be misleading to the overall series.
 2. We remove any days with negative new cases.
 3. We apply an outlier detection filter to the timeseries, which removes any data
    points that seem improbable given recent numbers. Many times this is due to
    backfill of previously unreported cases.

vaccinationsInitiated.title: Vaccinationsinitiated
vaccinationsInitiated.description:
Number of vaccinations initiated.

This value may vary by type of vaccine, but for Moderna and Pfizer this indicates
number of people vaccinated with the first dose.

vaccinationsCompleted.title: Vaccinationscompleted
vaccinationsCompleted.description:
Number of vaccinations completed.

This value may vary by type of vaccine, but for Moderna and Pfizer this indicates
number of people vaccinated with both the first and second dose.

TestPositivityRatioMethod.description: Method used to determine test positivity ratio.

NonCovidPatientsMethod.description: Method used to determine number of current ICU patients without covid.

Metrics.title: Metrics

testPositivityRatio.title: Testpositivityratio
testPositivityRatio.description: Ratio of people who test positive calculated using a 7-day rolling average.

caseDensity.title: Casedensity
caseDensity.description: The number of cases per 100k population calculated using a 7-day rolling average.

contactTracerCapacityRatio.title: Contacttracercapacityratio
contactTracerCapacityRatio.description: Ratio of currently hired tracers to estimated tracers needed based on 7-day daily case average.

infectionRate.title: Infectionrate
infectionRate.description: R_t, or the estimated number of infections arising from a typical case.

infectionRateCI90.title: Infectionrateci90
infectionRateCI90.description: 90th percentile confidence interval upper endpoint of the infection rate.

icuCapacityRatio.title: Icucapacityratio
icuCapacityRatio.description: Ratio of staffed intensive care unit (ICU) beds that are currently in use.

vaccinationsInitiatedRatio.title: Vaccinationsinitiatedratio
vaccinationsInitiatedRatio.description: Ratio of population that has initiated vaccination.

vaccinationsCompletedRatio.title: Vaccinationscompletedratio
vaccinationsCompletedRatio.description: Ratio of population that has completed vaccination.

Metrics.description: Calculated metrics data based on known actuals.

RiskLevel.title: RiskLevel
RiskLevel.description:
COVID Risk Level.

## Risk Level Definitions
 *Low* - On track to contain COVID
 *Medium* - Slow disease growth
 *High* - At risk of outbreak
 *Critical* - Active or imminent outbreak
 *Unknown* - Risk unknown
 *Extreme* - Severe outbreak

FieldSource.title: FieldSource
FieldSource.description:
The data source of a field (metric or actual). This enumeration lists the places from which
CAN fetches data. The source is tracked on a per field and region timeseries basis.

original_observation.title: Original Observation
original_observation.description: Original value on this date detected as anomalous.

fips.title: Fips
fips.description: FIPS Code. FIPS codes are either 2-digit state codes, 5-digit county codes, or 5-digit CBSA codes.

state.title: State
state.description: 2-letter ANSI state code. For CBSA regions, state is omitted.

lat.description: Latitude of point within the state or county. Currently a placeholder.

tags.name: County Data
tags.description: County level data for all US counties.

tags.name: State Data
tags.description: State level data for all US states + Puerto Rico and Northern Mariana Islands.

tags.name: CBSA Data
tags.description:
Aggregated data for all [core-based statistical areas
(CBSA)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Core-based_statistical_area).

CBSAs represent collections of counties that are socioeconomically linked.

They are used to represent metropolitan and micropolitan (at least 10,000 people
and fewer than 50,000 people) areas.

For example, the Seattle-Tacoma-Bellevue, WA CBSA is an aggregation of King County,
Pierce County, and Snohomish County.

CBSAs are currently in beta and may not contain all metrics or data.
